intro: Pyrenaria microcarpa var. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited pyrenaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, spherical fruits that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, hairy structures. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, adding visual interest to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
